result.execSummary:
The defendant Cortez S Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Consecutive to: Count 4, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($243) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Court waives DNA surcharge.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
No use or possession of any weapons or firearms under any circumstances.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling if Agent deems appropriate.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Cortez S Johnson in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Chelsea Williamson.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to counts 3, 4 & 5.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 3, 4 & 5.
Counts 1 & 2 are dismissed as read ins.


Court orders the following:
Count 3: 
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Consecutive to Count 4.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Concurrent to:  Count  4 & 5.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling is agent deems appropriate.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No violent contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No possession of a weapon under any circumstances.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.



Count 4:
225Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
155 Days Credit.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.




Count 5:
6 Month in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Consecutive to:  Count 4 & 3.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2  Years.
Concurrent to:  Count 4 & 3.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 3.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  
Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence and not prior to 6 months following discharge from supervision.
